snippet: Libya’s successful voting for the national assembly is an important step forward.
abstract: Editorial welcomes the success of Libya's first democratic national assembly elections, which attracted about 65 percent of all registered voters; notes that the new assembly will face several difficulties, including the role of Islamic law and how much autonomy to grant the country's restive eastern region.
lead_paragraph: Libya’s successful voting for the national assembly is an important step forward.

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
